channel.title: What in your life, are you grateful for?
channel.description:
For me, there are many, many things. Part of where this comes from, is I had a buddy who recently died from cancer. While he was still alive, there were a bunch of us having coffee. There was this one guy who bitches about every stupid pathetic, little thing. He complains and rarely finds the good in things. Santos looks over at him and says, "I am about to die - do you really think that what you are bitching at, is worth investing your life in? Life is too short, take it from me." Santos died shortly after. So, tragedy aside, what are you grateful for?
Just for bones, photography.
What are some of yours?

item.title: What in your life, are you grateful for?
item.dc:creator: Note-anator
item.description:
I am grateful for decent mothers.

Thank God (Whatever God there may be - Being as this is a female oriented comment, does it seem reasonable to mention Hestia?) They do still exist.

item.title: What in your life, are you grateful for?
item.dc:creator: Hanzales
item.description:
My eyes, ears, voice, hands, legs (all three of them) and my soul. I really dont want loose anything from this. And I’m grateful for BMS team as well. Because they are working on my latest and bigest computer based dream. Remake of my most favourite FPS shooter ever. (not counting SystemShock and Deus Ex1 but that’s a lil bit different genre)

item.title: What in your life, are you grateful for?
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
MysticJ:

There is no chain. It’s a circle. We pity poor chinese farmers, working hard on their rice fields… And they pity us for our stressful lives, our divorce rates…

you assume that I had pity for people with a life like that.

it is humanly impossible to deduce whose life is worse than whose but somewhere, weather it is starving on a mat in the middle of africa or sitting in an office chair with paperwork stacked high, there is someone who’s life sucks more ass than anyone else in the world.

/offtopic

Read full topic

item.title: What in your life, are you grateful for?
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

always makes me wonder who the poor bastard is at the end of that chain.

An American businessman went on a vacation to coastal Africa, where he met a fisherman. And asked him “What do you do during your day?”

  • “I wake up in the morning, around 9, go to the sea, catch 2 or 3 fish, then go home around 11, give the fish to my wife, and she cooks them. And I spend the rest of my day sitting on the beach, watching kids play, enjoy the sun and warmth…”
  • “But, if you woke up 2 hours earlier, you could catch 3 times as much fish!”
  • “Yeah? And what would I do with all that fish?”
  • “Well, you could sell the surplus fish on the market and make some money.”
  • “Yeah, and then what?”
  • “Well, you could hire few fishermen, who would go fishing with you, and then you could catch 10 times more fish and sell those too, and make even more money!”
  • “Yeah? And then what?”
  • “With all that money, you could buy a new boat, and make two fishing trips instead of one, and catch even more fish and make even more money!”
  • “Yeah? And then what?”
  • “Well, if you continued expanding like this, soon you’d be a director of a huge fishing company, and would earn huge amounts of money!”
  • “Yes? And then what?”
  • “Well, one day, you will be able to retire, buy yourself a nice house on the beach, and just sit on a chair, watch the kids play, enjoy the sun and warmth…”

There is no chain. It’s a circle. We pity poor chinese farmers, working hard on their rice fields… And they pity us for our stressful lives, our divorce rates…

Read full topic
item.source: What in your life, are you grateful for?

item.title: What in your life, are you grateful for?
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

Knowing that no bad how your troubles may seem, that you’re always better off than someone else.

always makes me wonder who the poor bastard is at the end of that chain.

I’m grateful for a house and a decent paying job, awsome family and awsome friends.

I really can’t belive that this thread has gotten three pages long without anyone saying it so I am going to continue being the zelous Monk/Inquisitor that I am and say Black Mesa.
